fields.summary: homepage performance analysis post default

content.text: Period-7 Oct- 20 Nov Compared with 17 Aug- 30 Sep

CTA performance is strong and top-funnel lead capture is working well (+341% clicks, +133% Get Started conversion). However, the Get Started form is the critical bottleneck, with Thank You completion rate collapsing from 9.76% to 2.38%.

fields.summary: Call with remarketing team on Halloween and further research

content.text: shared idea with team for black friday .

Hi i have a suggestion . It might be a good idea to start our campaigns about a week before Black Friday, or maybe even a bit earlier, to begin creating some buzz. The focus could be on encouraging investment in skilled, talented people who keep delivering resultsâ€”even during the holiday period. One challenge that many face around Black Friday is the limited availability of resources or increased workloads, which can cause delays or work getting stuck.
"Your business never sleeps" â€” gently highlighting how having skilled remote staff helps maintain productivity 24/7 during the holiday and beyond.
"Unlock holiday productivity" â€” subtly positioning remote staffing as a way to keep business momentum going while others take a break.

This approach might resonate well with clients who are looking for peace of mind and consistent performance during critical times, without sounding too pushy. And this could be further explained with free trails, extended trails, free audit, price drop if we can do that.Â
analyzing and creating suggestions for social team.
suggestion are related to traffic optimization along with page for mobile
shared idea with team for black friday theme

content.text: Explored several sources indicating that cognitive biases like anchoring, social proof, scarcity, and confirmation bias influence user decisions. These biases can be strategically utilized in CRO to enhance content effectiveness.

fields.summary: Previous idea lab cro videos

content.text: Video- cro agenda 2025Â & 27dec 2024 cro and ppcÂ
Content & CTA Issues â†’ Current video and CTA placements are weak: not engaging, poorly visible, and not driving enough clicks or conversions.
User Behavior & Data Tracking â†’ Need deeper analysis of CTR, time on page, video engagement, bottom CTA clicks, and conversions between funnel stages.
Optimization Opportunities â†’ Better positioning of CTAs/forms, remarketing from video viewers, testing form alternatives, and ensuring consistent messaging across services.
Data-Driven CRO Approach â†’ Focus on measuring cost per acquisition, blog/article impact on SEO & leads, persona targeting, and structured testing (offers, designs, page experience).
Integrated Optimization â†’ Landing page strategy must align with PPC & CRO to prevent stagnation at 2â€“3% conversion; campaigns, keywords, and page flow should complement each other.
Key Metrics to Track â†’ Drop in conversions, campaign performance trends, keyword effectiveness, and cost per acquisition must be analyzed systematically.
Portfolio & Services Positioning â†’ Strong first impression is critical; pages should showcase services, portfolio, and profiles in a convincing manner for both IT and non-IT personas.
Action-Oriented Framework â†’ Focus on hypothesis testing, user surveys/testing, identifying patterns behind conversion drops, and aligning all page sections into a cohesive funnel.
Together, these notes suggest you need a data-first approach to CRO + PPC, where page design + campaign data + user behavior are tracked, analyzed, and optimized in sync
viewing and referring key points from videos
Watched and analyzed Benchmarking & Minimalism video
shaun latest feeedback on new va pages

issuetype.name: Task

content.text: Run an A/B test to improve headline clarity and CTA effectiveness to increase lead submissions and CTA clicks.
Current headline and subheadline lack clear value and benefit messaging. The primary CTA has a generic label and low visual prominence, contributing to reduced user engagement and conversion.
Simplifying headline messaging and enhancing CTA text and design will reduce user friction and increase clicks and conversions.
Control: Existing headline/subheadline and â€œGet Startedâ€ CTA
Variant: Revised headline (e.g., â€œBoost Conversions with Psychologyâ€) and action-oriented CTA (e.g., â€œHire My Designerâ€) with enhanced button color and hover effect
4 weeks using Zoho PageSense with Bayesian analysis.

resolution.description: Work has been completed on this work item.
resolution.name: Done

fields.summary: Webdesigner page Phase 1 Test 1  - Landing Page Headline, Subheadline & Primary CTA Text, Color and Design Optimization

content.text: A/B Test Banner headline and sub headlines
Headline and subheading do not clearly communicate valueÂ
customer benefits (e.g., increased conversions, sales, revenue)Â
"When your designer is a behavioral science expert, your brand connects and converts."
"Turn your brand into a conversion starter. Work with designers trained in psychology."
Make the headline value focused: Clearly state the business benefits for the visitor.Â
"Boost Conversions and Sales with Psychology-Driven Design."
"Hire Designers Trained to Turn Your Brand into a Conversion Engine."
Generic CTA text; not action-oriented or benefit driven.Â
Button lacks strong visual cue (color contrast, interactive feedback).Â
CTA text should finish the sentence:
Ensure shape and size communicates â€˜buttonâ€™ (rounded edges, drop shadow, etc.)Â

fields.summary: Analyzing the abnormality in homepage data

content.text: Thereâ€™s a big spike in traffic on the older homepage on the 18th and 19th. Itâ€™s almost 4x the sessions we saw on the 16th and 17th. Whatâ€™s interesting is that itâ€™s all coming from organic and direct sources.
Right now, about 70% of the traffic is still going to the old homepage, and only 30% is hitting the new one.
This is because AB testing from zoho was paused on 18th then resumed on 19th and then again paused on 20th and new one started. As redirection and traffic split logic is created on zoho.

fields.summary: Creating homepge comparison latest data

content.text: new data is added and report is finalized for submission.
This report analyses user interaction and key performance metrics for the old homepage (/)Â
and the new homepage (/home-b) over the selected time frame. The goal is to determineÂ
the impact of the new design on user engagement and conversion.
The new homepage drove higher engagement,
with 4% users reaching "Get Started" (vs. 2% earlier) and conversion improving to 0.32% (vs. 0.21%).
The new homepage encouraged 10% more visitors to scroll to the footer compared to theÂ
Call-To-Action (CTA) buttons such as â€œStart a Quick Callâ€ and â€œGet Started Nowâ€ remainÂ
primary, but hover and click behaviour shows design improvements
New Homepage: The redesigned CTA achieved an 87.5% rise in hovers and a 72%Â
increase in the rate at which those hovers converted to clicks

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: As per our Zoho setup, the traffic is correctly split â€” 60% to the variant page (/home-b) and 40% to the original (/). However, in GA4, the sessions for the original page are showing much higher than expected.
1. Identify the root cause of discrepancy
4. Implement the mitigation steps to prevent future errors.

resolution.description: Work has been completed on this work item.
resolution.name: Done

fields.summary: Homepage split url testing ,sessions discrepancy in GA4

content.text: Here are some potential solutions for us to consider and discuss with Pradeep before implementation:
Store the split ratio in a GTM variable (e.g.,
) for tag-based setups or in a config file/server variable for code-based setups.
This allows changing the percentage (e.g., 50/50, 40/60) without redeploying code.
Always log the percentage used to ensure reporting aligns with the intended split.
Identify User Group on Page Load
Redirect Group: Send traffic to variant URL.
Stay Group: Keep traffic on control/original URL.
Use a random percentage generator in GTM or code.
Use a persisted cookie to maintain consistent group assignment across sessions or page loads.
Suppress GA Tracking on Original for Redirect Group
Use GTM blocking triggers or conditions to prevent GA tags firing for redirect group.
This will prevent double counting sessions in both original and variant pages.
Perform JavaScript redirects after suppressing GA tracking.
Ensure UTM and tracking parameters are passed on to the variant URL.
Avoid server-side (301/302) redirects unless server-side tracking is also implemented.
Track on the Final Landing Page Only
Fire GA tracking only on the page the user ultimately sees:
Test both paths using GA Real-Time reports to verify accuracy.
Handling Variable Percentage in Every Test
Update only the split percentage variable in GTM or config when starting new tests.
Clear or expire cookies used for group assignments when beginning new tests to re-randomize users.
Save group assignments in cookies to avoid fluctuating between redirect and stay groups on page reloads or new sessions.
Implement via GTM custom JavaScript variables or server-side logic.
Use GTM Preview Mode or browser developer tools to:
Confirm redirect logic matches intended split.
Ensure GA tags do not fire on original page for redirect group.
Verify UTM parameters are preserved through redirects.
Check cookies for consistent group assignments.
Use GA Real-Time to ensure no duplicate sessions are recorded
Meeting Summary â€“ Homepage Session Variation Analysis
The initial session variation between homepage versions was caused by
To mitigate this, the traffic split on the new homepage was increased from
, but this led to further discrepancies in session data.
, traffic is now evenly split at
session variation of no more than 5%

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: While attempting to modify the Primary CTA via Zohoâ€™s visual editor for a testing variant, it was found that changes could not be made directly. The visual editor allows CSS overrides onlyâ€”the Primary CTA is hardcoded in the HTML, using global CSS classes like
. This setup prevents any direct editing of button text, style, or link from the Zoho editor (or similar tools).

resolution.description: Work has been completed on this work item.
resolution.name: Done

fields.summary: Primary CTA Not Editable in Visual Editor due to Hardcoded Global CSS (btn btn-primary)

content.text: Refactor the Primary CTA implementation to use editor-friendly components or widgets.
Expose button text, style, and link as editable fields in the page builder/visual editor (instead of hardcoded HTML).
Avoid relying solely on global CSS (
) for critical CTAs; use modular or platform-native buttons that support easy editing for future experiments and quick content updates.
Temporarily made necessary changes using custom CSS for the test variant.
Identified root cause for future development.
Assign developer to refactor Primary CTA as described above.
Confirm editability in visual editor (Zoho or any similar tool) after update
discussed with sanjay, to be taken with developer
